title: What To Actually Do About 'Something Big Is Happening
author: Ryan Brodsky

title: What Happens When Everybody Can Do Everything?
author: Matt Hastings

title: AI Is for All of Us: Why These Tools Were Built from Our Collective Knowledge
author: Matt Hastings

title: We Had to Figure Out AI. No One Told Us How.
author: Jill Ozovek

title: AI Is a Thinking Tool: How to Build Scaffolds That Expand What You Can Do
author: Matt Hastings
description: AI isn't just a productivity tool — it's a thinking tool. Learn how to build scaffolds that expand your ability to reason through complex problems.

title: Why Does AI Give Different Answers? Understanding AI's Probabilistic Superpower
author: Matt Hastings

title: Getting Started With Claude Code: The Non-Developer's Guide (It's Just a Chat Window)
author: Ryan Brodsky
description: The last tech lesson you'll ever need. Once you're set up with Claude Code, you can just ask Claude how to do everything else.

title: You Only Use 10% of Your Computer: Vibe Coding and the New Skill of Work
author: Matt Hastings
description: Most of us dramatically underutilize the computers in front of us—not because we're not smart enough, but because we didn't have access to the translation layer. Vibe coding changes that.

title: 4 Well-Intentioned AI Approaches That Miss the Mark
author: Jill Ozovek
description: Most organizations approach AI adoption with the same playbook they've used for every other technology rollout. Here's why that doesn't work—and what actually moves the needle.

title: I Never Knew You Could Be So Nostalgic for 12 Months Ago
author: Ryan Brodsky
description: The tools that felt like miracles a year ago now feel primitive. But that's exactly why it's easier than ever to start.

title: A Corporation in Your Pocket: What Happens When White-Collar Work Becomes Infrastructure
author: Matt Hastings
description: As AI abstracts away white-collar work, the power to create value shifts from corporations to individuals. What does it mean to have a corporation in your pocket?

title: I Took Three Months Off from AI. Here's What I Learned When I Came Back.
author: Jill Ozovek
description: The biggest barrier to AI adoption isn't technical skill—it's the belief that you've missed too much to start. Here's why that's wrong.

title: Can You Use AI to Replace Your Employer? A Different Way to Think About the Future of Work
author: Matt Hastings
description: Instead of waiting to be replaced by AI, what if you could use AI to replace your need for an employer? Exploring a reframe for the anxious labor market.

title: The AI Time Paradox: Why You Can't Find Time for the Skill You Need Most
author: Matt Hastings
description: AI adoption is a practice skill, but the workplace pressure driving the need for AI is the same pressure stealing your time to learn it. Here's what to do about it.

title: Why AI Doesn't Work Like Regular Software: Probabilistic vs Deterministic Tools
author: Matt Hastings
description: AI is probabilistic, not deterministic. Learn why this matters and how to shift your approach for better results.

title: Why 95% of AI Projects Fail (And What To Do Instead)
author: Matt Hastings
description: The real barrier to AI adoption isn't technical—it's the gap between understanding and practice. Here's what actually works.
